title: Leonardo Pinto Arata
text:
Hola ! I am Leonardo (or Leo if you prefer), and I am a researcher in cognitive psychology. My work focuses on the learning of linguistic regularities during reading and the underlying prediction processes. I also study the learning of non-linguistic regularities in human and non-human primates in order to investigate the general mechanisms involved in language processing.
I have a Msc. Neuropsychology and Cognitive Psychology from the University of Aix-Marseille. Then, on 20 December 2024, I defended my Ph.D at the Centre de Recherche en Psychologie et Neurosciences in Marseille, France.

title: Third Blog Post
text:
The source for any page in your website could also be a Jupyter Notebook. This one is third-post/index.ipynb.
Here’s an example I borrowed from the Seaborn docs:

import seaborn as sns

sns.set_theme(style="whitegrid")

# Load the diamonds dataset
diamonds = sns.load_dataset("diamonds")

# Plot the distribution of clarity ratings, conditional on carat
sns.displot(
    data=diamonds,
    x="carat", hue="cut",
    kind="kde", height=4, aspect=1.5,
    multiple="fill", clip=(0, None),
    palette="ch:rot=-.25,hue=1,light=.75",   
)

title: Projects
text:
Predicting House Prices with Machine Learning



Python


Machine Learning


Data Cleaning



This project involves using machine learning algorithms to predict house prices based on various features such as location, size, and amenities. It includes data cleaning, feature engineering, and model selection.



Jan 1, 2024














Customer Segmentation Using Clustering Techniques



R


Machine Learning


Clustering


Statistical Modelling



This project focuses on segmenting customers into different groups based on their purchasing behavior and demographics. It uses clustering algorithms like K-means and hierarchical clustering to identify distinct customer segments.



Apr 1, 2024














Visualizing Global CO2 Emissions



R


Data Visualization


Environmental Science



This project involves creating visualizations to show trends in global CO2 emissions over time. It includes data extraction from public databases, data cleaning, and using visualization libraries to create interactive charts and graphs.



Jul 1, 2024

title: Publications
text:
The dynamics of multiword sequence extraction

Pinto Arata, L., Ordonez Magro, L., Ramisch, C., Grainger, J., & Rey, A. (2024). The dynamics of multiword sequence extraction. Quarterly Journal of Experimental Psychology, 77 (12), 2439–2462.DOI: 10.1177/17470218241228548
View   PDF  Code & Data




Chunking mechanisms in language and other domains

Pinto Arata, L., Tosatto, L., & Rey, A. (2024). Chunking mechanisms in language and other domains. L’Année psychologique, 124(3), 375–408. DOI: doi.org/10.3917/anpsy1.243.0375
